item.title: New botnet exploits vulnerabilities in NVRs, TP-Link routers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Mirai-based malware campaign is actively exploiting unpatched vulnerabilities in Internet of Things (IoT) devices, including DigiEver DS-2105 Pro DVRs. [...]

item.title: European Space Agency's official store hacked to steal payment cards
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: European Space Agency's official web shop was hacked as it started to load a piece of JavaScript code that generates a fake Stripe payment page at checkout. [...]

item.title: FBI links North Korean hackers to $308 million crypto heist
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The North Korean hacker group 'TraderTraitor' stole $308 million worth of cryptocurrency in the attack on the Japanese exchange DMM Bitcoin in May. [...]

item.title: Clop ransomware is now extorting 66 Cleo data-theft victims
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Clop ransomware gang started to extort victims of its Cleo data theft attacks and announced on its dark web portal that 66 companies have 48 hours to respond to the demands. [...]

item.title: Adobe warns of critical ColdFusion bug with PoC exploit code
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Adobe has released out-of-band security updates to address a critical ColdFusion vulnerability with proof-of-concept exploit code. [...]

item.title: FTC orders Marriott and Starwood to implement strict data security
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has ordered Marriott International and Starwood Hotels to define and implement a robust customer data security scheme following failures that led to massive data breaches. [...]

item.title: Premium WPLMS WordPress plugins address seven critical flaws
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Two WordPress plugins required by the premium WordPress WPLMS theme, which has over 28,000 sales, are vulnerable to more than a dozen critical-severity vulnerabilities. [...]

item.title: US court finds spyware maker NSO liable for WhatsApp hacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A U.S. federal judge has ruled that Israeli spyware maker NSO Group violated U.S. hacking laws by using WhatsApp zero-days to deploy Pegasus spyware on at least 1,400 devices. [...]

item.title: Apache fixes remote code execution bypass in Tomcat web server
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Apache has released a security update to address an important vulnerability in Tomcat web server that could lead to an attacker achieving remote code execution. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes bug behind random Office 365 deactivation errors
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has rolled out a fix for a known issue that causes random "Product Deactivated" errors for customers using Microsoft 365 Office apps. [...]

item.title: North Korean hackers stole $1.3 billion worth of crypto this year
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: North Korean hackers have stolen $1.34 billion worth of cryptocurrency across 47 cyberattacks that occurred in 2024, according to a new report by blockchain analysis company Chainalysis. [...]
